intro: Guarea reticulatovenosa, commonly known as the veiny guarea, is a tropical tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and other valuable hardwoods. The plant is characterized by its large, compound leaves with a distinctive reticulated venation pattern. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically appearing in axillary inflorescences. The tree produces woody capsules that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind or animals.
